Description: Mix of five sherds, four of them hand-made neolithic Nubian ones, one is a rim sherd and is well polished, wheel-made reused Christian (?) with shallow impressions at the outside. The others are quite eroded with different decoration at the outside. A: body sherd with dotted lines at the outside, no number. B: AWS 23, body sherd, dotted lines. C: AWS 51, X, AW 38/3j9, rim-sherd, herring bone like incised lines. D: AWS 5(?)34, small rim sherd with incised lines. E: AWS 206, E Bank near house, rim-sherd, shallow fine impressions at the outside, polished.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
